item.description:
A brunch on any week is a good idea; a brunch celebrating the traditional time of harvest, and the useful regularity of the moon (thanks for all you do, little guy) is a great idea. Read more about various cultural traditions tied to festivals at this time of year: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsukimi; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuseok; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhongqiu_Festival.

Dim sum on Sundays being popular, and dim sum on holidays before even more so, we are 1) unable to make a reservation, and 2) expecting all the local restaurants to be busy. So please come at 11:30 with the expectation that we might not be seated until noon, and even then, we will likely be broken up into a few small coveys. That's alright, even so -- small groups make for good conversation. I'll be bringing nametags for the convenience of all.

And do, do bring cash -- it shall make the payment process go much smoother.
item.name: Mid-Autumn Festival: Dim Sum & Mooncakes
